title: 'He's Gone to a Lot of Meetings': Trump Is Exasperated by Zelensky's Relentless Undermining of Alaska Peace Talks (VIDEOS)
description: As it was fully expected, Kiev regime leader Volodymyr Zelensky is becoming a major obstacle in the peace process between Russia and Ukraine.
content:
As it was fully expected, Kiev regime leader Volodymyr Zelensky is becoming a major obstacle in the peace process between Russia and Ukraine.

Even though Gallup poll shows 70% of Ukrainians want negotiations to end the ear, he is still dragging his feet and demanding what he can’t have.

The MSM darling has splashed his stance on endless newspaper articles, as in the non-exhaustive list from the last week alone:

The Washington Post: “Ukraine will reject any proposal that involves ceding territory to Russia, Zelensky says”; BBC News: “Volodymyr Zelensky says Ukraine will not give up land as Donald Trump suggests idea ahead of meeting Vladimir Putin in Alaska”; Reuters: “‘Ukrainians will not give their land to occupiers,’ President Zelenskiy said”; The Straits Times: “Zelensky says Ukraine will not cede land to Russia for peace”; Bloomberg: “Zelenskiy Rejects Ceding Land as Key Security Officials Meet”.

This has made US president Donald J. Trump publicly criticize Zelensky for his lack of progress in peace building.

Watch: ‘He’s gone to a lot of meetings…he’s been there for three and a half years and NOTHING happened’

Watch: ‘[Zelensky] got approval to go into war and kill everybody but he needs approval to do a land swap’.

Zelensky has rallied the Euro-Globalists, and so you have France’s Emmanuel Macron, Germany’s Friedrich Merz, Poland’s Donald Tusk, as well as EU unelected bureaucrats – all publicly debating and rejecting a plan that hasn’t even been formed and negotiated – much less divulged.

But Trump is laser-focused on peace and prosperity.

summary: Kiev regime leader Volodymyr Zelensky is becoming a significant obstacle in the peace process between Russia and Ukraine, despite a Gallup poll showing 70% of Ukrainians want negotiations to end the conflict. Zelenskiy has insisted that Ukraine will reject any proposal involving ceding territory to Russia and has been criticized for his lack of progress in peace building. This has led to US President Donald J. Trump publicly criticising him for not attending many meetings and expressing frustration over his lacklustre stance.
shortSummary: Volodymyr Zelensky, Ukraine's leader, is hindering the Alaska peace talks by repeatedly rejecting offers to cede land to Russia, despite public support.

scraped_sources.text:
The world is living a week of maximum expectation in anticipation of Friday’s historic meeting between US President Donald J. Trump and Russia’s Vladimir Putin in Alaska.
As the two countries prepare themselves for the momentous summit, the uninvited European Globalist leaders are in a panic, seeking to talk to Trump before he joins Putin to try to end the war in Ukraine.
Bloomberg reported:
“The leaders want to speak to him before Friday when Trump and Putin are due to meet, said the people, who spoke on condition of anonymity to discuss private deliberations.”
While many haven’t spoken to Trump yet, the weekend was full of diplomatic activity, with a meeting of US, Ukrainian and European officials on Saturday in the UK, hosted by Vice President JD Vance and British Foreign Secretary David Lammy.
“EU ambassadors were briefed on the talks on Sunday and the bloc’s foreign ministers are scheduled to convene virtually on Monday.”
While the precise terms of the negotiated deal have not been disclosed, Bloomberg is reporting that Putin demands the entire eastern Ukrainian region of Donbas as well as Crimea to implement a ceasefire and begin negotiations over a lasting settlement.
“If the process moves forward, territory would ‘have to be on the table’, along with security guarantees for Ukraine, NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said Sunday on ABC’s This Week. He suggested that could involve Ukraine acknowledging that it has lost control of some of its territory without formally giving up sovereignty over those regions.”
Read: Gallup Poll Shows Seven in Ten Ukrainians Want Negotiations to End the War
Zelensky has come public to reject the deal that haven’t even been negotiated yet, saying that no Ukrainian territory will be ceded to Russia.
“Under the terms of the deal that US and Russian officials have been discussing, Moscow would halt its offensive in the Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions of Ukraine along the current battlelines.”
Read more:
Russians Warn ‘Titanic Efforts’ Are Underway to Disrupt the Trump-Putin Meeting in Alaska

argos_summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is seen as a barrier to peace negotiations with Russia, despite a Gallup poll indicating that 70% of Ukrainians favor negotiations to end the war. Zelensky has publicly rejected any proposals involving territorial concessions to Russia, drawing criticism from US President Donald Trump for his lack of progress in peace efforts. As Trump prepares for a significant meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin, European leaders are reportedly anxious to discuss the situation before the summit.
